alternatives.transcript: the function of the leaf processing and storage division is to process and store the company's tobacco requirements and to deliver the tobacco to the production Division and a tobacco processing division when needed

the majority of our tobacco's are acquired at auctions held throughout the tobacco growing areas the marketing of the crop begins in early to mid July for the flue-cured leaf which is grown along the Eastern Seaboard from Northern Florida to Virginia as soon as the flue-cured markets closed a Burly markets open usually the Monday before Thanksgiving and close late January or early February the Burley tobacco is grown in Western North Carolina Virginia West Virginia Kentucky Tennessee Ohio Indiana and Missouri

the processing of the incoming Leaf is a seasonal operation beginning with flue-cured Leaf in July and ending shortly after the close of the Burley Market Leaf processing involves removal of the stem from the leaf and the drying and packaging of the resulting components for storage and aging these components are strips stems scrap and dust to give you an idea of the scope of this operation we will see slides of the various stages of the process

the tobacco is hauled in by tractor trailer and unloaded with industrial clamp trucks this is in sorted by grade and placed in a humidified holding area in large quantities until enough to buy go of a particular grade is on hand to process from the humidified holding area the tobacco enters a strip feeders the strips are them search for foreign matter by inspectors the strips are then conveyed to a rotating cylinder the strip conditioning occur
by adding water and steam to the tobacco while it passes through the drum the strips now enter the first thrashing and separator units where the leaf is removed from the stem
checks are made to ensure recovery of as much stem free Leaf as possible

the stems with lamina or relief remaining are then fed into a second thrashing unit where it is again thrashed and separated this sequence of thrashing and separating has done a total of five times after the leaf is removed from the stem is then conveyed to a series of sizing reals where the strip's scrap dust and sand or separated the strips are now fed into a blending bin where they are thoroughly mixed to ensure uniformity of grade the next stage is redrawing
the strip stems scrap and dust are dried and specially designed dryers
the strips are then packed into their respective containers for storage as are the stems
and scrap the materials are then transported from the plant to large sheds for aging
and Storage

after aging for 18 to 24 months these components are ready to be delivered to the production Division and the tobacco processing division is needed at this point we moved to the tobacco processing division which is responsible for the production of reconstituted tabaka expanding strips Turkish blending plug rapper and roll stemmed also used in our smoking and plug products

the product at 6:03 processing is G7 tobacco which is reconstituted from a blend of stems scrap and dust we receive the raw materials from least storage and current production from the production division these materials are ordered and delivered daily
the materials are then delivered to the blending area
here they are mixed or Blended

the Blended materials are now conveyed to the extractor section through screw conveyors once in the extractor section the materials are saturated with hot water in large mixing tanks pumped through a series of presses for the liquid flavors are removed or extracted the extractable liquids will be reapplied to the pope Sheet later in the process

in addition to the G7 extract a gene on Dust extract is produced here we extract a tobacco flavor from the Dust by using machines called centrifuges the G7 and G9 extracts are later mixed together the pulp slurry all remaining solids are pumped from the extractor to the refining section in the refining section we separate the stem fiber so we can form a pulp sheet
the pope slurry is now pumped to the star chest which is a holding tank for the forming machines

these machines former Pope sheet and remove excess water by press rolls and vacuum the sheet is then transferred to a dryer after transferring and before entering the drying machine the extract liquid is reapplied by sprayers to the pulp sheet

after spraying the sheet it is then conveyed into the drying machines where it is dried to the desired moisture level by hot air the sheet is in inspected for quality and is pulled into the sizing machines the sizing machines pull the finished product into slitters and Cutters which size of Tabata into 2 by 3 inch strips the sized strips are now conveyed to the packing stations where they are packed into boxes cans or hogsheads the moisture content is checked
and related to the dryer operator
the strips are then stored and sent to the Turkish department for use when needed

at 601 Turkish the G7 strips are blended with a Turkish tobacco which is imported from countries such as turkey Italy Bulgaria Greece and Cyprus these tobacco's are noted for their Aroma the Turkish de Vaca is received in veils and unloaded from trucks the industrial truck operator pulls at Ibaka onto the scales where the weight is recorded and verified by a company employee and a government official it is in placed in a bondage storage area where taxes
must be paid before this tobacco can be used after the tax has been paid it is then ready to be placed on the feed belt to the bag cutters

the bags are cut and removed from the tobacco tobacco is then conveyed to the softening drums where Steam and water is added the strips are then conveyed to Bonkers after leaving the Walkers the strip's passed by inspectors that check for foreign matter and remove it the turkey strips then pass through separating units

well I'm sorry I moved and recirculated through the system at this point the G7 from 603 processing is conveyed to a mixing drum where it and the turkey strips are Blended the flow of Blended strips turkeys and G7 is regulated by a control center
these Blended devices are then delivered to the Hamlin feeders into casing in drying Department of the production division
another responsibility of the tobacco processing division is the G13 process G13 is the expanding of cut tobacco strips we refer to it as the puffing process
the Blended strips are received at the palate Packers

they come from the casing and drying Department of the production division the pallets are weighed and ticketed stored for eight hours and then placed in palette Breakers from the pallet Breakers the strips are conveyed to a casing drum where flavoring is applied

the strips then leave the casing drum on a vibrating conveyor and are conveyed to the Aging house which allows time for the flavoring to thoroughly penetrate the strips before they're cut the strips are now conveyed to cutters

here they are cut into a filler the cut filler is in conveyed to a watering drum where the moisture is increased by the addition of water the filler is encoding cans and health until a reserve has been accumulated his infant to the automatic scales which control the feed rate to each cooker or treater the to cookers have a large screw inside which conveys the tobacco through them the cookers contained vaporized free on which saturates the tobacco

after the tobacco has been saturated and leaves a cooker it falls into an air duct where expansion takes place the sudden change in the temperature causes the tobacco to expand or Puff resulting in an increased filling capacity for the tobacco itself

the hot air from the dryer fan blows the tobacco up to a separator which is located on top of the roof the separator removes the freon from the tobacco the freon is recovered through a recovery unit and reused the tobacco then returns through a stripping drum for further removal and recovery of freon

the tobacco is then conveyed to a final reordering dumb or desired flavoring materials are added and the desired moisture content is obtained its then conveyed to the can Packer or bokors for a minimum storage of 24 hours
the G13 product is now ready for use in the casing and cutting Department of the production division here is an example of this product being fed into the casing and cutting process

the function of the production division is to order and receive the different types of tobacco from Leaf processing and storage and the tobacco processing division to Tobacco is conditioned Blended cut and flavoring applied and then delivered to the making and packing area for the actual production of cigarettes the Burley and flue-cured tobacco Czar received from the leaf processing and storage division by truck upon arrival the hogsheads are unloaded and recorded
I'll Burley and flue-cured enters a vac you Don
the vacu dine adds moisture to prevent breakage of strips
after leaving the vacuum dine the hogsheads then proceed to a cut-down area where all patented size and heads are removed the tobacco is then ready for blending

tobacco is then placed on the blending line where feeders are used to blend the Burley and flue-cured strips these strips are Blended separately each feeder has its own feed control and a master control to increase or decrease the flow of tobacco

the strips now pass through separate moistening drums where Steam and water is used to increase the moisture and to delaminate the tobacco the strips are then conveyed to cleaning drums and checkmark separators the cleaning drum has a 1 and 1/2 inch wire mesh that strips passed through and are then conveyed to the checkmark separators where stems and foreign matter are removed by the use of are the strips then pass across wide searching tables where inspectors pick out any
better

these strips are then conveyed to the casing and drying Department to the Hamlin feeders were Burly and flue-cured strips are fed separately each blend has a pounds per minute flow which is controlled by these feeders the amount of liquid casing application or flavoring applied is critical the Burly strips then pass through a liquid casing drum where casing or flavoring materials are added the Burly strips are then conveyed to the dryers and fed through at a rate of 450 pounds per

it with the top temperature of 265 degrees using to dryers the moisture content will be reduced to 12 and 1/2 percent these strips are then inspected as they leave the dryers at this point the turkeys in G 7 billion from the tobacco processing division comes through a Hamlin feeder from this feeder the flow is controlled by pounds per minute according to the blend the strips of Burly are then conveyed to a top dressing drum

so we're at this point it becomes known as cased Burly the Burly flue-cured and Turkish blend tobacco falls into a mixing drum and completes this portion of the blend for a particular brand after blending these strips are conveyed to the pallet Packers where each pilot will weigh 3,000 to 3,500 pounds this tobacco will remain on these pallets for a minimum of 48 hours
these pallets are transported to the storage area and marked according to the grade

after Proper Storage the pallets are then placed on the pallet Breakers the strips are then conveyed to the casing drums where with one drum for cutter lion steam water and flavoring her added in preparation for cutting
the strips then pass across vibrating conveyors to the Aging house from the Aging house the tobacco passes to the leg cutters
each cutter Cuts 12,500 to 13,000 pounds per hour at 32 Cuts per inch from the cutter the tobacco is conveyed to a flotation chamber and then enters the at dryer for excess moisture is removed
between the dryer and top dressing drum the final Blend is completed by adding G13 to buy a car or Puff from the tobacco processing division
the cut filler is now conveyed to the tub Packers where each color has its own tub packer

the tubs are packed with 190 pounds of cut filler perturb the tubs are then stacked in a storage area for 24 hours then they are delivered to the making a packing departments after storage these tubs are transported to the re dressers which are divided into three sections the tobacco is placed in each section according to the moisture content each operator is responsible for the flow age and the moisture content of the cut filler being
virtue the making and packing Department the tobacco then travels to the homie feeders
the feeders pneumatically control the flow of tobacco to the cigarette making machines a constant flow of cut filler with the correct moisture content is critical at this point
the pneumatic feed system conveys the divider to The Hoppers of the mark 9 cigarette making machines

the tobacco passes through the machine and dust and WT stems are removed the tobacco is formed into a rod is wrapped by cigarette paper which is pasted and folded it's cut into proper length may or may not have a filter attached by a filter attaching device it is inspected for quality and finish cigarettes travel to the Oscar
the Oscar or overhead conveyor and Reservoir stores cigarettes and feeds them into the packing machine as needed
the AMF packing machines receives cigarettes from the Oscar and count inspect form and wrap 20 cigarettes into a finished package that is ready to be inspected for proper quality

the cutting machine receives packs from the packing machines and count fold and seal a carton around 10 packages the cartons travel up a carton elevator to an overhead conveyor which takes them to the case packer
the case Packer collects packs and seals 60 cartons in a case and deliver the cases by conveyor to the shipping Department

the function of the shipping division is to receive cases of cigarettes from the production division which will be shipped to Consumers all over the world the case has received from the production division are routed by conveyor for loading into a rail car or truck for shipment to one of 78 warehouses the cases can also be routed to a stacking area where they can be palletized for transfer to other shipping departments these cases are held in storage until they are needed to be loaded

local shipments are loaded into trucks for delivery to Distributors within a 300-mile radius of Winston-Salem all shipping departments are bonded areas and a physical inventory must be made twice daily since a federal excise tax of $48 per 12m case is paid at the time they are shipped the shipping division loads approximately 30 rail cars and 35 trucks daily accounting for a total of some 80 thousand cases of product

now let's proceed to our flavoring division the function of the flavoring adhesive division is to service the production division by Furnishing the highest possible quality flavorings adhesive and other specialty items in the area of flavorants the flavoring division maintains an inventory of over 250 raw materials which include liquids powders and solids
the raw materials are received by commercial carriers in quantities from 1 to 400 pounds and by Rail and tank cars
each raw material received his sample for Quality with careful checks being made to ensure that the material meets established specifications

after the raw materials are approved they are ready to be used in some 70 various concentrates developed by our product development department each for a specific purpose each formula is mixed by two people carefully double-checking each item
each lot of concentrate is sample to ensure the concentrate meets established specifications as an additional check each lot is Wade ensuring the proper yield
the concentrates are then used to formulate top dressing flavors which are ready to be sprayed on a cut filler

there are approximately 30 various top dressings each developed for a specific purpose after the top dressing is mixed it is placed in inventory ready to be shipped to the various plants in the area of adhesives the same procedures Prevail we receive raw materials by commercial trucks Rail and tank cars
each raw material is sample with quality control checks to ensure that each material meets established specifications

the largest category in the adhesive area is polyvinyl acetate emotions they are all white in appears but each of the 15 various formulas are designed for a specific purpose the identification label on each drum is very important each lot of adhesive is carefully measured and weighed according to the formula these materials are pumped into meals or tanks to be mixed to the desired Solutions
each lot of adhesive is sampled by quality control and check before being shipped another category of adhesive as Hotmail which at room temperature is solid
by formula various materials are placed in Pre melt tanks these materials are Blended at a specified temperature and are fed into pressure tanks

Under Pressure the Hot Melt is forced through a series of petcocks into chilled water each strand is continuously pulled into a chopper the Hot Melt then passes through a dryer and into a drum for shipping again each lot is sampled by quality control checks as with flavorings we deliver adhesives to each plant as ordered
along with flavorings and adhesive specialty items such as liquid hand soap furniture polish and hand cream or manufactured by this division

as you have seen the manufacturing process is one that is quite complex with each department dependent upon the other and yet with all of our complexity we are quite simply a chain our strength lies in our ability to work as a team we've come a long way since 1875 but we can go further and we will
